messages.message:
I ran into an issue with response generation & provenance in Converse:
• Document (see attached Coca-cola 10k)
• Ran using Research mode
• Screenshot 2 shows the response being truncated
• Clicking on the document/provenance pill takes you to the view you're seeing on SS3, which does not produce bounding boxes
• Env/Chat info:
    ◦ Prod, 24.48.6
    ◦ Org: `Customer Enterprise Demo`
    ◦ https://aihub.instabase.com/converse/0193d1ec-adfe-702a-8d67-924c5c18d58c
Conversation repro steps:
• User utterance 1: `Summarize this document`
• *User utterance 2: `Are there any checkboxes marked? What do they mean?`
• *User utterance 3 (research mode ON): `Are there any checkboxes marked? What do they mean?`  
    ◦ Agent response: (last screenshot shows responses + expanded "steps")

Adding a related issue to this thread:
The "steps" in the multistep execution log seem to depict an error when trying to parse/extract the adjusted close price values from the CSV on the left; however, the agent generation seems to have captured them properly -- so it looks like the messaging in the steps is a bit misleading?
